thread.title: Ranked: Houston TV news reporters, anchors and their Klout scores
thread.title_full: Ranked: Houston TV news reporters, anchors and their Klout scores

author: John-Henry Perera, Houston Chronicle
title: Ranked: Houston TV news reporters, anchors and their Klout scores
text:
Kaitlin Monte - Reporter for KRIV-TV Klout score: 70 Kaitlin Monte - Reporter for KRIV-TV Klout score: 70 Photo: Ting-Li Wang/Fox Television Stations/Courtesy To The Houston Chronicle Image 24 of 24 Ranked: Houston TV news reporters, anchors and their Klout scores 1 / 24 Back to Gallery 
Houston's TV news broadcasters are all over social media, Tweeting out updates, Facebooking their promos or Instagramming their fancy galas. 
We wanted to know which reporters and anchors are better at the social media game than others, so we turned to Klout . The social analytics website rates users based on their online footprint and assigns them a "Klout score" from 0-100. 
Of course, the methodology isn't fool-proof. Not every TV broadcaster uses Klout, and the score itself isn't an exact representation of how much "influence" a person has. 
Some reporters have even had a leg up, carrying over their out-of-city audiences to their new jobs. 
Check out the gallery above for a ranking of Houston's top TV broadcasters.
